markdown:
<title level="1" right="Deity " pfs="Standard">[Demon Bringers](/Deities.aspx?ID=230)</title>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<traits>
<trait label="LG" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
</traits>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods of the Expanse](/Sources.aspx?ID=92) pg. 0</row>

The Mwangi Expanse is full of dangers. Of particular note are the various [demons](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28) and other [Abyssal](/Planes.aspx?ID=13) creatures that roam the jungles. Many of these creatures are drawn to the Mwangi Expanse by the presence of [Angazhan's](/Deities.aspx?ID=72) or [Lamashtu's](/Deities.aspx?ID=11) might, while others are direct servitors of those faithful to the demonic. While the Mwangi Expanse is home to many demon hunters that keep these evil forces at bay, many of them work in independent groups. It's only with the combined efforts of the demon hunters that the Mwangi Expanse can be rid of this demonic presence and the people of the Mwangi Expanse can be safe.

  The demon hunters among the Ekujae elves, Matanji orcs, Mwangi catfolk, Mbe'ke dwarves, and others began to join forces in their demon hunts and brought their respective gods with them. This led to the worship of a pantheon of righteous gods that both offered the might to destroy demons and the wisdom to defend others. Through the worship of [Adanye](/Deities.aspx?ID=223), [Chohar](/Deities.aspx?ID=215), [Kazutal](/Deities.aspx?ID=41) (in her form as Majagua), and [Torag](/Deities.aspx?ID=18), these mighty hunters find the strength they need to make the Mwangi Expanse a safer place. While this pantheon didn't originally have a name, the local Mwangi populations eventually dubbed them the Demon Bringers, as their faithful would bring home trophies in the form of demon heads, claws, or tails. Followers of the Demon Bringers use their skills to hunt demons and other evils that lie within the Mwangi Expanse. They also help create homes and fortifications for those that can't fight, as the ultimate goal of the Demon Bringers is a safer Mwangi for all.

<column gap="tiny">

**Category** [Pantheons
](/DeityCategories.aspx?ID=18)

**Edicts** create fortifications and defenses to protect those who can't protect themselves, improve your hunting abilities, seek out evils that threaten others

**Anathema** exclude innocents from safe havens, intentionally destroy a shelter, allow demon summoners to live on unpunished

**Area of Concern**
protection, retribution, and keeps

**Follower Alignments**
LG, LN, NG, CG

**Pantheon Members**
[Adanye](/Deities.aspx?ID=223), [Chohar](/Deities.aspx?ID=215), [Kazutal](/Deities.aspx?ID=41), [Torag](/Deities.aspx?ID=18)

</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
<title level="2">Devotee Benefits</title>

<column gap="tiny">

**[Divine Ability](/Backgrounds.aspx?ID=132)**
Strength or Constitution

**Divine Font** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148)

**Divine Skill** [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16)

**Favored Weapon** [Machete](/Weapons.aspx?ID=294)

**Domains** [Creation](/Domains.aspx?ID=5), [Family](/Domains.aspx?ID=11), [Might](/Domains.aspx?ID=20), [Protection](/Domains.aspx?ID=27)

**[Alternate Domains](/Rules.aspx?ID=802)** [Cities](/Domains.aspx?ID=3), [Duty](/Domains.aspx?ID=45)

**Cleric Spells**

- **1st**
[Mage Armor](/Spells.aspx?ID=176)

- **4th**
[Creation](/Spells.aspx?ID=54)

- **7th**
[True Target](/Spells.aspx?ID=346)

</column>
name: Demon Bringers
